results.title: Calgary cowboy stampede
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: On the screen in close-up, and often in slow motion - the furious action of the world famous Calgary stampede - a spectacle to pin every viewer to their seat. Sun-fishing broncos, dare-devil cowboys, thundering chuckwagons - they are all here in this film of the annual extravaganza of the west. From the series: The Sport Parade.

results.title: Calder Hall: how a thermal reactor works
results.creator_credit: Ace Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Report to Geneva on the progress of Britain’s first nuclear power station, Calder Hall (close to Windscale Atomic Factory, Cumberland), July 1955. Describes the construction of the piles and the reactor. The film covers the various stages from the beginning of work on the preparation of the site in April 1953 to the summer of 1955 when the power station was three-quarters completed.

results.title: Calder Hall
results.brief_description: A report on Calder Hall, Britain’s first atomic power-station, as it was in July 1955. An engineer explains the layout of the two piles and the turbine house which will eventually produce electricity for a wide area.

results.title: Calcutta
results.brief_description: Calcutta is one of India’s largest cities. Paul Cox’s camera explores the lives of the poorest of its inhabitants. Filled with the vibrant sounds of Indian music, the culture of the people of Calcutta is rich and vital despite the harsh conditions in which they live.

results.title: Calculated risk
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide, British Petroleum and Julian Sprio
results.brief_description: The story of the search for oil in a Middle East sheikhdom. This “calculated risk” involved ten years of planning and work, and an investment of some 25 million pounds. Shows how, in the case of the Umm Shaif underwater oilfield at Abu Dhabi on the Arabian Gulf, this immense engineering project culminated in the departure of tankers for Europe with the first cargoes of crude oil.

results.title: Cake decorating with Robyn Hamilton. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Robyn Hamilton continues with her demonstration on cake decorating techniques. This part is for the more advanced student on the art of lace, frilling, insertion, extension.

results.title: Cairo: as told by Youssef Chahine
results.creator_credit: Mustapha Abdel Aziz, Misr International Films, Miroirs and Youssef Chahine
results.brief_description: Personal documentary essay on the city of Cairo by renowned Egyptian filmmaker Youssef Chahine. Director of over forty films, Chahine is renowned for his diverse styles and often controversial subject matter. “Cairo as told by Youssef Chahine” began as a commission by French TV for the news series Envoye Special. Using his unique sense of artistic digression, Chahine begins the film by poking fun at conventional travelogue imagery of Cairo, before going on to explore, from a deeply personal perspective, the contemporary political, religious and social life of the city he loves. The film was banned in Egypt for showing too much dirt.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mustapha Abdel Aziz, Misr International Films, Miroirs and Youssef Chahine

results.title: Caged fury (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventure parade”.
WARNING: CONTAINS VISUALLY DISTURBING IMAGES Man’s capture and training of wild African beasts. The animals are seen in their native surroundings and the continual struggle for survival is depicted in scenes of fighting and killing. Shows the animals being trapped and shipped abroad, and the training methods through which they gradually adapt themselves to a new life.

results.title: Cage/Cunningham
results.creator_credit: Elliot Caplan, La Sept and Cunningham Dance Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merce Cunningham Dance Company = Cunningham Dance Foundation”.
Feature length documentary portrait tracing the history of the collaboration of choreographer, Merce Cunningham, and composer, John Cage, which spanned nearly fifty years beginning at the Cornish Institute of Allied Arts in Seattle, Washington. In telling the story of Cunningham and Cage, award winning filmmaker and Cunningham collaborator, Elliot Caplan, utilizes candid footage of their activities around the world since 1983, rare footage from the Cunningham and Cage archives, and interviews with principal figures involved in the collaboration. Caplan’s daily contact with Cage and Cunningham has inspired a revealing and sensitive portrait of two men whose spirit of adventure and iconoclastic thinking have helped to revolutionize life, as well as art in the twentieth century. Includes interviews with Nam June Paik, Robert Rauschenberg, Carolyn Brown, Viola Farber and Rudolf Nureyev. Choreography by Merce Cunningham. Music by John Cage. Reference: http://www.merce.org/filmvideo.html
